name: Consultation
author: admin
body: Candid review of GaIn will assist the Global Adaptation Institute in creating a model that is sound, objective and pragmatic. Examination of responses will be in accordance with best practices of consultation processes and all comments will be carefully considered. Individual feedback from reviewers will remain confidential to protect the integrity of the deliberative process. The reviewer’s name will be acknowledged unless they indicate they wish to remain anonymous. Interested reviewers are asked to examine the methodology and approach of GaIn, as well as its technical details. Please [fill out our questionnaire](https://spreadsheets.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dFNhNk9GX295UWF1NExuNzUxRnBSVFE6MQ&ndplr=1) or email us your thoughts to gain@globalai.org. You can also mail comments to: Global Adaptation Institute 1747 Pennsylvania Ave NW, Suite 1125 Washington, D.C. 20006 ##Revision Notes ###First Brainstorming meeting. * Initial meeting to define goals and next steps. * Held in Washington, September 2009 ###Scientist first meeting. * blabla ###First working version: GaIn 0.5 * Internal version. * Implemented in Google Docs for easier collaboration. * Completed by February 2010. ###Scientist meeting * Invited xx scientist from around the world to review, comment and advice on improvements for current version of the Index. *Held in Washington, May 2010, at the President´s club and the Parks Association. *The meeting concludes with the creation of a Council of Scientific Advisors ###Revised version: GaIn 0.7 *Implementation partially ported to Microsoft Excel for faster development. *Completed by February 2010. ###First Consultation * with the Council of Scientists, the Council of Advisors. ###Revised version: GaIn 0.8 blabla ###Open Consultation * Upon review of the model, we opened the consultation for public scrutiny. * Creation of a dedicated website. ###Revised version: GaIn 0.9 blabla ###First release: GaIn 1.0 *September 14th *Website developed to make the Index easy to use and reference, full transparency and openly download. Implemented using node.js and MapMill. ##Next Steps Possible improvements in mind. * Intranational scale * Ecosystems * Urban
